@t<home.footer.message>: Built with ❤️ using the React Vite Starter template. Swap this hello page with your first feature!
@t<home.header.description>: This friendly landing page is proof that everything is wired up. Replace it whenever you're ready, or keep it around as a quick-reference for scripts, stack, and docs.
@t<home.features.heading>: Everything you need to ship fast
@t<home.features.description>: Opinionated but flexible. Swap any tool or extend the stack without redoing the plumbing work.
@t<home.features.cards.opinionatedDefaul: React 19, TypeScript, Vite 7, and Tailwind CSS ship preconfigured so you can focus on product work instead of tooling.
ESLint, Prettier (with Tailwind sorting), and ready-to-run scripts keep your commits neat and repeatable.
@t<home.features.cards.localizationReady: Tolgee client scaffolding and CLI scripts are already wired up whenever you are ready to translate copy.
@t<home.features.cards.safeByDesign.desc: Strict TypeScript settings, React StrictMode, and sensible lint rules catch issues long before production.
@t<home.features.cards.composableStructu: A batteries-included src tree with app, components, hooks, and utils directories scales with your project.
@t<home.features.cards.utilityFirstStyli: TailwindCSS is ready out-of-the-box with PostCSS so you can ship polished UI without touching config.
@t<home.resources.heading>: From idea to prototype in minutes
@t<home.resources.description>: Use this starter as a hello page, onboarding doc, or QA checklist. The faster everyone on the team can get into the app, the better your next release will be.
@t<home.resources.steps.copyRepo>: Copy this repo or scaffold your own via Git.
@t<home.resources.steps.runCommands>: Run the commands above to install dependencies and start dev mode.
@t<home.resources.steps.tweakSuffix>: or drop in your own routes.
@t<home.resources.steps.keepScripts>: Keep the scripts handy for linting, formatting, and Tolgee localization.
@t<home.resources.links.vite.description: Understand how Vite handles dev, build, and previews.
@t<home.resources.links.react.descriptio: Refresh modern React patterns, hooks, and compiler plans.
@t<home.resources.links.tailwind.descrip: Browse utility classes and component recipes.
